document.masterDocTitle: Neotropical spittlebugs related to Neaenini (Hemiptera, Cercopidae) and the origins of subfamily Cercopinae

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Neotropical spittlebugs related to Neaenini (Hemiptera, Cercopidae) and the origins of subfamily Cercopinae

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of
Zuata
(* unknown male)

paragraph.keyLead: 1. Tegmen with pale veins (visible only on smoky tips if tegmen ivory colored).....................................30
2. Tegmen (and often also scutellum) with bold ivory, yellow or orange markings contrasting to brown or black ground color 10
- Tegmen brown, tan or red without obvious paler markings..................................................... 3
3. Tegmen dark brown or with black border at tips; length 8–9 mm ; Colombia ...................................... 7

4. Head orange, concolorous with tegminal base; length 11 mm ; Ecuador.....................
ochraceorosea (Lallemand)

6. Head black, contrasting with orange pronotum; tegmina with small yellow to orange streaks; Colombia......
pictilis
sp.nov.

- Head concolorous with at least anterior margin of pronotum; tegmina unmarked; Bolivia...........
ravidella (Lallemand)

8. Tegmen uniformly red except for black tip................................................
sierrana (Lallemand)

- Tegmen brown with red confined to costa................................................
marginata (Lallemand)

- Head and dorsum dark red; sides of face and 4 pits on anterior edge of pronotum black.................
hysginon
sp.nov.
10(2). Tegmen with pale transverse line or band near tip of clavus.................................................. 25
- Tegmen with broad areas of ivory, yellow or orange.........................................................11

11. Black with posterior two-thirds of tegmina contrastingly yellow.....................................
infecta
sp.nov.
- Black with yellow saddle across tegmina or marks limited to smaller areas....................................... 12
12. Tegmen with large yellow patch extending at least across basal half of clavus..................................... 22
- Tegmen with smaller yellow to ivory marks, or patches orange in color.......................................... 13

14. Dorsum bisected by yellow bands extending across anterior edge of pronotum and from bases of tegmina across scutellum; length 8 mm ; Ecuador ...................................................................
segui (Lallemand)
16. Head and wings black, contrasting with orange spots...................................... bimaculata (Lallemand)

- Head black, contrasting with brown to orange body and wings.....................................
ravida (Jacobi)

17(14). Pronotum with yellow anterior margin; Colombia .........................................
bipunctata (Lallemand)
- Pronotum darkest on anterior margin; Peru ............................................... * punctata (Lallemand)

18(13). Black marked with ivory crossbands on head and thorax in addition to longitudinal stripes on scutellum and tegmina; wing tips also with round white patch; 8 mm ; Colombia ...................................................
zebra
sp.nov.

19. Tegmen with pale streak along claval suture and often 1–2 spots on corium; length 6.5 mm ; Colombia...
includens (Walker)
- Tegmen with parallel yellow streaks on both claval suture and corium........................................... 20

20. Head black, contrasting with orange band across pronotum; length 7.5 mm ; Venezuela...............
araguana (Fennah)
- Head and pronotum black; length 5–6.5 mm ; Bolivia to Peru.................................................. 21

21. Tegmen with wedge-spaced ivory mark on clavus................................................
scapula
sp.nov.

- Tegmen with more extensive marks in yellow.....................................................
pica (Jacobi)
23. Black, with yellow band extending across scutellum; 5 mm .................................... transita (Lallemand)

- Black with yellow band extending across pronotum, and with a patch on each tegminal base; 7.5–8 mm ............................................................................................... carvalho Paladini & Cryan

25(11). Tegmen with narrow, white transverse line; Bolivia ..............................................
ligatura
sp.nov.
26. Tegmen with yellow or orange line along claval suture....................................................... 29

27. Both pale area of tegmen orange; length 7.5–8 mm .........................................
tettigoniella (Breddin)
- Base of tegmen darker than pale band across wing tips; length 5–6 mm .......................................... 28
28. Base of clavus orange, band across wing tip yellow; Peru............................... luteofascia Carvalho & Webb

29(26). Pale line on claval suture connected to transverse line near tip of clavus; length 5 mm ; Bolivia to Peru.... *
angulata (Jacobi)

- Pale lines on claval suture and transverse line not connected; length 7–9 mm ; Colombia to Paraguay.....
nolckeni (Fowler)
30 (1). Head black, contrasting with light brown thorax; length 8 mm ; Colombia....................... pecki Paladini & Cryan

- Head, pronotum and tegmina yellow to ivory boldly patterned in black; length 9 mm ; Peru.............
machadoa
sp.nov.
